title: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
body:
Hi there,

#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`
OS & Version: Windows
Commit hash : (if `develop`)
v1.9.0-unstable-645756cd-20190604/windows-amd64/go1.12.5"

#### Expected behaviour


#### Actual behaviour

```
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x8 pc=0x6833be]

goroutine 713 [running]:
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.(*SyncBloom).Contains(0x0, 0xc00026f340, 0x20, 0x20, 0x0)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/sync_bloom.go:182 +0x4e
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.(*Sync).AddSubTrie(0xc011020450, 0x6a7f0c186ffe4dc1, 0x6339490e79a76e6f, 0xe0c4d1a2f4f363fb, 0x4c2c8dcc5ae2713e, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, ...)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/sync.go:104 +0x135
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie.NewSync(0x6a7f0c186ffe4dc1, 0x6339490e79a76e6f, 0xe0c4d1a2f4f363fb, 0x4c2c8dcc5ae2713e, 0x70c5010, 0xc000004680, 0xc000060330, 0x0, 0xc017a0a200)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/trie/sync.go:91 +0x295
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/state.NewStateSync(0x6a7f0c186ffe4dc1, 0x6339490e79a76e6f, 0xe0c4d1a2f4f363fb, 0x4c2c8dcc5ae2713e, 0x70c5010, 0xc000004680, 0x0, 0x0)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/state/sync.go:40 +0xbb
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.newStateSync(0xc0118b5180, 0x6a7f0c186ffe4dc1, 0x6339490e79a76e6f, 0xe0c4d1a2f4f363fb, 0x4c2c8dcc5ae2713e, 0x0)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/statesync.go:243 +0x95
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.(*Downloader).syncState(0xc0118b5180, 0x6a7f0c186ffe4dc1, 0x6339490e79a76e6f, 0xe0c4d1a2f4f363fb, 0x4c2c8dcc5ae2713e, 0x1)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/statesync.go:63 +0x61
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.(*Downloader).processFastSyncContent(0xc0118b5180, 0xc01198db00, 0x0, 0x0)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/downloader.go:1579 +0xac
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.(*Downloader).syncWithPeer.func7(0xc000000008, 0x17bcc38)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/downloader.go:533 +0x3a
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.(*Downloader).spawnSync.func1(0xc0118b5180, 0xc000377bc0, 0xc00012b840)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/downloader.go:547 +0x60
created by github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.(*Downloader).spawnSync
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/downloader.go:547 +0xb6
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour


#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````
Thanks for the report. Do you have any more logs preceding it?

I should mention that this is Goerli Testnet
That's not the exact same trace -- does that mean you get it repeatedly? What's the command line arguments?

Yeah, I get these errors at startup repeatedly. Just ran it again now this:

@rfikki I take your issue is solved.

Would it be possible to notice and handle such situations more gracefully?

@karalabe I have had that node up and running for a long time. I have shut it down and started it numerous times. I have no way to remember whether it crashed the very first time. It is possible. Just found it odd that after such a lengthy time of running it, all of a sudden the errors. I just wanted to notify you guys just in case it was something that needed fixing. Thanks for looking into it. It is certainly entirely possible that due to an inadvertent power outage the node was shutdown abruptly. I honestly cannot be sure though.
This was fixed recently on master to avoid this ever happening, even in weird crash scenarios.

Hi @karalabe,  with geth 1.9.1 stable I faced the same issue.
I restarted to sync my chain after some period of time.

The latest release is 1.9.8, please try that.
